definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to watch out/to keep one's wits about one

sentences.english: Are you going to have dessert?
After eating the fine snack, Empress Dowager Cixi was fairly satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧太后吃了这精美的点心之后，很满意。

sentences.english: Most of the people who eat dim sum are Cantonese.
sentences.chinese: 吃粤式点心的人主要是广东人。

sentences.english: You can eat dim sum at Guangzhou Restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在广州酒家吃点心。

sentences.english: Tops nanna getting her grand-kiddy a soy milk treat.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶给她的孙女买一个豆奶点心。

sentences.english: You can eat some snacks first.
Marriage is a meal where the soup should be better than the dessert.
sentences.chinese: 汤比甜点心更佳的一顿饭。

sentences.english: They eat soly sweet dessert that only build up fat but no nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 他们只吃使他们长脂肪而无食物价值的甜点心。

sentences.english: The tradition of serving starters or hors d'oeuvres is said to have arisen in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 上开胃菜或餐前小点心的传统据说起源于俄罗斯。

sentences.english: Shall we have some dessert first?
sentences.chinese: 我们先来点儿甜点心好吗？

sentences.english: The special dessert the hostess prepared made a tremendous hit with everyone at the party.
sentences.chinese: 女主人做的甜点心在晚会上大受欢迎。

sentences.english: My mother brought some snacks out for my friends and me to have.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈端出一些点心给我和朋友们吃。

sentences.english: I like ice cream and cookies as much as the next guy.
sentences.chinese: 和其他人一样我也酷爱冰激凌和小点心。

sentences.english: The pork pie likely originated as a snack for hunting parties.
sentences.chinese: 猪肉馅饼很可能起源于狩猎会上的一道点心。

sentences.english: Present the person with a basket of fresh fruit or a homemade treat.
sentences.chinese: 送对方一篮新鲜水果或自己做的点心。

sentences.english: You will also want to eat two healthy snacks a day, between meals.
sentences.chinese: 您也将想要每天来两餐点心。

definition: tea and cake/refreshments/tea and dimsun 點心|点心, traditional Hong Kong lunch
food preserved in sugar or honey
to eat (of bird or animal)/to feed
